uk.ac.ebi.mdk.service
Interface ResourceLoader

All Known Subinterfaces:
MultiIndexResourceLoader, SingleIndexResourceLoader
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractChEBILoader, AbstractDerbyLoader, AbstractMultiIndexResourceLoader, AbstractResourceLoader, AbstractSingleIndexResourceLoader, BioCycCompoundLoader, BioCycStructureLoader, ChEBICrossReferenceLoader, ChEBIDataLoader, ChEBINameLoader, ChEBIStructureLoader, HMDBMetabocardsLoader, HMDBStructureLoader, KEGGCompoundLoader, KEGGCompoundStructureLoader, KEGGReactionLoader, LipidMapsLoader, LipidMapsSDFLoader, MetaCycCompoundLoader, MetaCycStructureLoader, TaxonomyLoader, UniProtCrossReferenceLoader
public interface ResourceLoader

ResourceLoader - 20.02.2012

Interface describes a resource that can load data from a ResourceLocation into a local file via the update() method.

Version:
$Rev$
Author:
johnmay, $Author$ (this version)

Method Detail

canUpdate

boolean canUpdate()
Determines whether required locations LocationDescription are accounted for via various ResourceLocations. Each location is checked with ResourceLocation.isAvailable() but this may not guarantee a error free update()

Returns:
can update resource

canBackup

boolean canBackup()
Determine whether the loader has files available to back-up (i.e. update() has run successfully at least once.

Returns:
can backup loader output

canRevert

boolean canRevert()
Determine whether the loader has files available to revert (i.e. backup() has been called).

Returns:
can revert loader output

update

void update()
            throws IOException
Update the resource output by parsing the ResourceLocations. The locations are accessed via the getLocation(String) method. If an attempt is made to retrieve a location that does not existing then a MissingLocationException is thrown. The canUpdate() method can be called to ensure all required locations are available and the loader should be able to 'update'. This method is allowed to throw an IOException but should be reserved for major failures. There may well be cases where an IOException will be thrown on a single record of thousands. This should be logged and not thrown (note: logging access has not currently been implemented).

Throws:
IOException - could not load resources

cancel

void cancel()
Cancel the update process. This method should inform the update process to terminate the update as soon as possible. The process should NOT automatically invoke backup(), this should be handled by an update manager.

uncancel

void uncancel()
Reset the cancelled state of the loader. This should be called by an update manager before invoking the update() method.

backup

void backup()
Create a backup of this loaders output, this method should be called before any calls to update() to ensure that revert() can be called should a problem occur. The call to this method before update() is not enforced but automatically calling it may be beneficial in a user-centric update manager.

revert

void revert()
Revert changes made by the last call to update(). This method will replace the current loader output with the backup (if available)

clean

void clean()
Remove all files and directories produced by this loader including the backups. This method will render dependant query services useless, therefore if this method is used in a user-interface the application should be prompted whether they really want to 'clean' the loader.

getName

String getName()
Access a description for this loader. In single index loaders this method can just return the name of the LuceneIndex.

Returns:
name of the loader

getRequiredResources

Map<String,LocationDescription> getRequiredResources()
Access the LocationDescriptions of the ResourceLocations that are required for the update() method. The key's in map should be used when adding ResourceLocations in the method addLocation(String, ResourceLocation); This method is primarily useful for user-interface update managers where the user can change the location's of the resources

Returns:
map of location key's to their descriptions

addLocation

void addLocation(String key,
                 ResourceLocation location)
Add location for a required resource. The correct key can be determined from the getRequiredResources() method.

Parameters:
key - key that will be used in getLocation(String)
location - the location to add

removeLocation

void removeLocation(String key)
Remove a specified location (note this will not removed the requirement)

Parameters:
key -

getLocation

<T extends ResourceLocation> T getLocation(String key)
                                       throws MissingLocationException
Access the stored location for the specified key. If the location does not exist for the specified key the an exception is thrown. Note: this is a generic method allow multiple return types providing they extend ResourceLocation. What this means is that if a LocationDescription requires a ResourceFileLocation you can call this method assigning to a variable of that type. ResourceFileLocation location = getLocation("chebi.sdf")

This is not type save so if the returned type does not extend the generic-type a ClassCastException will be thrown

Parameters:
key - key to fetch a location
Returns:
instance extending ResourceLocation
Throws:
MissingLocationException - thrown if the location has not been added
